item.title: As manhunt goes on, new images of person of interest in killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO
item.description: The manhunt continued in New York for the man wanted in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. New images emerged of a person of interest, who authorities say spent time at a hostile on Manhattan's Upper West Side. NBC News' Sam Brock reports.

media:content.media:title: As manhunt goes on, new images of person of interest in killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO
media:content.media:description: The manhunt continued in New York for the man wanted in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. New images emerged of a person of interest, who authorities say spent time at a hostile on Manhattan's Upper West Side. NBC News' Sam Brock reports.

item.title: Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield halts anesthesia payment policy after backlash
item.dc:creator: Mustafa Fattah
Sara G. Miller
item.description: Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield said Thursday it was not going ahead with a policy change that would limit reimbursements for anesthesia during surgery and medical procedures.

media:content.media:text: Anaesthetist placing mask on patient

item.title: Insurance executive's murder sparks online praise and hate
item.dc:creator: Ken Dilanian
item.description: Support or sympathy for the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO spread on social media, alarming some experts.

media:content.media:text: Brian Thompson, chief executive officer for UnitedHealthcare.
media:content.media:description: Brian Thompson was named chief executive of UnitedHealthcare in 2021.

media:content.media:text: Police presence in Hilton Hotel in Midtown Manhattan.
media:content.media:description: Police gather Thursday outside a Hilton hotel in midtown Manhattan where United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson was shot and killed.

item.title: Elon Musk spent a quarter-billion dollars electing Trump, including financing mysterious 'RBG PAC'
item.dc:creator: Bridget Bowman
Ben Kamisar
Scott Bland
item.description: Elon Musk poured more than $20 million into a mysterious super PAC at the end of 2024, part of more than $250 million he spent overall to boost Donald Trump.

media:content.media:text: Elon Musk puts on his sunglasses
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump and Elon Musk at the launch of the sixth test flight of the SpaceX Starship rocket in Brownsville, Texas, on Nov. 19.

item.title: Why has it been even hotter than expected recently? Research points to diminishing cloud cover
item.dc:creator: Evan Bush
item.description: Temperatures have risen far higher over the past two years than scientists expected. A study offers a possible reason why: Cloud cover has decreased.

media:content.media:text: Heatwave Hits East Coast With High Temperatures And Humidity
media:content.media:description: People try to keep cool in the water at Coney Island during a heat wave in Brooklyn, N.Y., on July 28, 2023.

item.title: Everything to know as Taylor Swift's historic Eras Tour makes its final stop in Vancouver
item.dc:creator: Angela Yang
item.description: Taylor Swift’s record-shattering Eras Tour is finally coming to a close after nearly two years of friendship bracelets, surprise songs and sparkly bodysuits.

media:content.media:text: Taylor Swift
media:content.media:description: Taylor Swift performs during the Eras Tour at Rogers Centre in Toronto on Nov. 14.

media:content.media:text: The BC Place Stadium
media:content.media:description: BC Place stadium in Vancouver, British Columbia, on May 2.

item.title: Manischewitz to sponsor first Jewish quarterback in BYU history
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosenstein
item.description: Brigham Young University's Jake Retzlaff, the first Jewish quarterback in program history, has signed an NIL (Name, Image and Likeness) sponsorship with the kosher food company Manischewitz, both announced Thursday.

media:content.media:text: BYU Quarterback Jake Retzlaff holds a box of Manischewitz Potato Latke Mix
media:content.media:description: BYU Quarterback Jake Retzlaff said Manischewitz, the iconic Jewish brand, “has always been part of my life.”

media:content.media:text: Jake Retzlaff holding a football
media:content.media:description: Jake Retzlaff has thrown for 2,796 yards, 20 touchdowns and 10 interceptions.

item.title: Lions defeat Packers 34-31 in thriller on 'Thursday Night Football'
item.description: 'Thursday Night Football': Packers face Lions in Detroit

media:content.media:text: Image: Green Bay Packers v Detroit Lions Josh Jacobs
media:content.media:description: Josh Jacobs #8 of the Green Bay Packers runs with the ball against the Detroit Lions during the second quarter in the game at Ford Field, in Detroit, on Dec. 5, 2024.

item.title: Nearly 100 former national security officials 'alarmed' at prospect of Gabbard leading intel community
item.dc:creator: Dan De Luce
Megan Lebowitz
item.description: Nearly 100 former national security officials signed a letter criticizing President-elect Donald Trump's decision to nominate former Rep.

media:content.media:text: tulsi gabbard politics political politician
media:content.media:description: Former Rep. Tulsi Gabbard at the Washington Hilton in Washington, D.C., on June 21.

item.title: AOC tells Democratic colleagues she's running for top job on Oversight Committee
item.dc:creator: Scott Wong
item.description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., has begun informing House colleagues that she is running to be the top Democrat on the influential Oversight Committee, according to three Democratic lawmakers who told NBC News they had had conversations with her.

media:content.media:text: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y.
media:content.media:description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., entrance into the race will pit her against Rep. Gerry Connolly, D-Va.

item.title: Secret Service chief and congressman get into shouting match at House hearing
item.description: During a hearing on the assassination attempt against President-elect Trump, acting Secret Service Director Ronald Rowe and Rep. Pat Fallon, R-Texas, got into a heated shouting match over an appearance Rowe made at a September 11 remembrance event in New York.

media:content.media:title: Secret Service chief and congressman get into shouting match at House hearing
media:content.media:description: During a hearing on the assassination attempt against President-elect Trump, acting Secret Service Director Ronald Rowe and Rep. Pat Fallon, R-Texas, got into a heated shouting match over an appearance Rowe made at a September 11 remembrance event in New York.

item.title: House votes against releasing Matt Gaetz ethics report for now
item.dc:creator: Scott Wong
Kyle Stewart
item.description: The House voted against releasing an ethics report on former Rep. Matt Gaetz on allegations of sexual misconduct and illegal drug use, referring the issue back to committee.

media:content.media:text: Matt Gaetz sitting in the House Chamber
media:content.media:description: Matt Gaetz, R-Fla., resigned from the House last month as he pursued an unsuccessful bid for attorney general.

item.title: Democrats must combat Trump's culture wars, new progressive chair says
item.dc:creator: Sahil Kapur
item.description: The Democratic Party messed up in the 2024 election against Donald Trump and needs a dramatic shift, new Progressive Caucus Chair Greg Casar said.

media:content.media:text: Representative Greg Casar, a Democrat from Texas, speaks in Austin, Texas, on Sept. 6, 2024.
media:content.media:description: Rep. Greg Casar, D-Texas, pictured in Austin in September, will lead progressives on Capitol Hill.

item.title: Ex-Proud Boys Leader dodges questions at trial of officer charged with feeding him intel
item.dc:creator: Julia Jester
Ryan J. Reilly
item.description: WASHINGTON — Former Proud Boys chairman Enrique Tarrio, who is serving 22 years in prison on charges related to the Jan. 6 Capitol attack, sparred with a federal prosecutor and a judge and refused to answer questions related to Jan. 6 on Thursday during combative testimony in the trial of the former head of intelligence for Washington, D.C., police.

media:content.media:text: Enrique Tarrio.
media:content.media:description: Former Proud Boys chairman Enrique Tarrio refused to answer questions about Jan. 6 on the stand.

item.title: John Fetterman says Hunter Biden, Trump both deserve pardons after 'politically motivated' trials
item.dc:creator: Annemarie Bonner
Sahil Kapur
item.description: John Fetterman said Thursday that the federal cases against Joe Biden’s son, Hunter Biden, and the New York state hush money case against Donald Trump were both “politically motivated” and deserving of pardons.

media:content.media:text: Former President Donald Trump's Hush Money Trial Continues In New York
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump attends his trial for allegedly covering up hush money payments at Manhattan Criminal Court on May 20, 2024 in New York.

item.title: Earthquake rattles coast of California and triggers brief tsunami warnings
item.description: An earthquake with a preliminary 7.0 magnitude struck just off the coast of Northern Carolina, rattling a large area along the coast. The quake caused minor damaged and briefly triggered tsunami warnings. NBC News' Liz Kreutz reports.

media:content.media:title: Earthquake rattles coast of California and triggers brief tsunami warnings
media:content.media:description: An earthquake with a preliminary 7.0 magnitude struck just off the coast of Northern Carolina, rattling a large area along the coast. The quake caused minor damaged and briefly triggered tsunami warnings. NBC News' Liz Kreutz reports.

item.title: Gunman who wounded 2 kids at California school had past convictions
item.dc:creator: Phil Helsel
item.description: The man who shot two kindergarten children at a Northern California Christian school had a history of mental illness and pretended to be interested in enrolling a relative at the school to get onto campus, the Butte County sheriff said Thursday.

media:content.media:text: butte county palermo california school adventist shooting
media:content.media:description: Police investigate the shooting at Feather River Adventist School, in Palermo, Calif., on Dec. 4, 2024.

item.title: Family of Missouri teen who fell to his death on Orlando free-fall ride gets $310 million verdict
item.dc:creator: Tim Stelloh
item.description: A Florida jury delivered a $310 million verdict Thursday to the family of Tyre Sampson, the Missouri teenager who plunged to his death on a free-fall ride at an amusement park over two years ago.

media:content.media:text: tyre sampson memorial orlando florida
media:content.media:description: Family members and friends of Tyre Sampson leave items during a vigil in front of the Orlando FreeFall drop tower in ICON Park in Orlando, Fla., on March 28, 2022.

item.title: After much anticipation, University of Michigan’s board doesn't vote on defunding DEI
item.dc:creator: Curtis Bunn
item.description: The University of Michigan Board of Regents did not vote on whether to defund its diversity, equity and inclusion program at its final meeting of the year Thursday following protests on campus to keep the embattled program intact.

media:content.media:credit: Emily Elconin for the New York Times
media:content.media:text: Protesters rally against changes the University of Michigan is considering to its DEI program
media:content.media:description: Protesters rally Monday against changes the University of Michigan is considering to its DEI program.

item.title: Woman who flew from New York to Paris without a ticket is charged in federal court
item.dc:creator: Chloe Atkins
Jay Blackman
Rebecca Cohen
item.description: The woman who officials say boarded a flight without a ticket in New York during the Thanksgiving holiday and was detained upon landing in Paris has been charged with being a stowaway.

media:content.media:text: court sketch Svetlana Dali stowaway
media:content.media:description: Svetlana Dali sits in federal court flanked by the court translator, from left, and her defense attorney Michael Schneider, from right, on Dec 5, 2024.

item.title: Yoon should not remain as South Korean president, his party leader says
item.dc:creator: Stella Kim
Jennifer Jett
item.description: The head of South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s governing party on Friday signaled more openness to his removal as president for declaring martial law.

media:content.media:text: Image: South Korea Descends Into Crisis After Lawmakers Overturn President's Declaration Of Martial Law
media:content.media:description: South Korean lawmakers blocked entry to the National Assembly in Seoul on Friday ahead of a possible visit by President Yoon Suk Yeol.

media:content.media:text: South Korea's ruling party chief Han demanded on December 6 that President Yoon Suk Yeol stand down over his martial law attempt, warning he posed a great danger to the country.
media:content.media:description: Han Dong-hoon, leader of Yoon’s conservative People Power Party, in Seoul on Friday.

item.title: Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire offers a fragile peace some fear won't be enough
item.dc:creator: Tovah Lazaroff
item.description: JERUSALEM — The ceasefire between Israel and Lebanon’s Hezbollah appeared on the verge of collapse this week — something that is not a surprise to many Israelis.

media:content.media:text: People Return To Their Communities On The Lebanon / Israel Border After Ceasefire Agreed
media:content.media:description: A local man returns to his damaged home in Manara, a kibbutz along the Israeli border with Lebanon on Dec. 2, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Middle East tensions soared Saturday as Iran and its allies readied their response to the assassination of Hamas's political leader, blamed on Israel, spurring fears of a regional war.
media:content.media:description: Israel's Iron Dome air defense system intercepts rockets fired from southern Lebanon in northern Israel on Aug. 4.

media:content.media:description: A Hezbollah supporter holds a poster of assassinated leader Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut in October.

item.title: France in political chaos as Paris gears up for the reopening of Notre Dame Cathedral
item.dc:creator: Chantal Da Silva
item.description: As French President Emmanuel Macron prepared for the reopening of the Notre-Dame Cathedral, he faces calls to step down after his prime minister resigned and the government collapsed.

media:content.media:text: French Government No-Confidence Vote at National Assembly
media:content.media:description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier during a no-confidence debate at the National Assembly in Paris on Dec. 4, 2024.

item.title: A man 'leapt' onto a polar bear to protect his wife during rare attack in Canada
item.dc:creator: Tim Stelloh
item.description: A man who “leapt” onto a polar bear when it lunged at his wife during a rare attack earlier this week was seriously injured but is expected to recover, tribal authorities in Canada said.

media:content.media:text: A polar bear in the arctic national wildlife refuge in Kaktovik, Alaska, in 2013.
media:content.media:description: A polar bear in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in Kaktovik, Alaska, in 2013.

item.title: Two children remain in critical condition after California school shooting
item.description: Two children, ages 5 and 6, were in critical condition after being shot by a gunman at the religious elementary school they attended. Officials investigating a motive say the suspect had met earlier with the school's principal. NBC News' Jesse Kirsch reports.

media:content.media:title: Two children remain in critical condition after California school shooting
media:content.media:description: Two children, ages 5 and 6, were in critical condition after being shot by a gunman at the religious elementary school they attended. Officials investigating a motive say the suspect had met earlier with the school's principal. NBC News' Jesse Kirsch reports.
